titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. P. H. Campbell, Transcript
CWG4993

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Owen Circuit Court
Pleas before E. F. Nuttall Judge of the Owen Circuit Court at the Court House in Owenton on May 2d 1859.

The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
agst } Indictment for Felony
P. H. Campbell Deft
Be it remembered that heretofore to wit on the 8th day May 1856. at a circuit Court began and held for Owen County at the Court House in Owenton
Came the grand Jury for Owen County and filed in said court an Indictment agst the Deft which Indictment is in the words and figures following (viz)

"Owen Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of kentucky
against
Preston. H. Campbell

"The grand Jury of Owen County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Preston H. Campbell of the crime of Shooting at H. R. Abbott with intent to Kill committed as follows(viz)

'The Said Preston H. Campbell on the day of December 1855 in the County of Owen did unlawfully and with intent to kill or
Wound Shoot at One H. R. Abbott three times with a pistol Commonly called a revolver against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

R. W. Masterson attorney
for Commonewealth Protem
upon the foregoing Indictment is the following indorsement (To Wit)

"A True bill"
R. H. Alexander foreman
At A Circuit Court began and held for the county of Owen at the Court house in Owenton On Monday May 2d 1859. the following Order was made in this cause (viz)

The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
agst } On Indictment
P. H. Campbell Deft

Came parties by their attorney and by consent of parties Deft confessed Judgment for Eighty six dollars & costs" It is therefore adjudged by the court that the Deft do make his fine to the Commonwealth of Kentucky by the payment of Eighty six dollars together with the costs of this prosecution and that he be taken &c.
State of Kentucky } Sct
Owen Circuit Court
I W. H. Sandford Clerk of the Circuit Court in and for the County and State aforesaid do certify that the foregoing two pages contains a true copy of the Indictment and Judgment therein mentioned..
Given under my hand this 23d day of June 1864.

W. H. Sandford clk
By Lawrence Sandford D C

June 25 recommended by J S Scott Comths Atty in person
Tho E Bramlette

Owen Cir Ct
The Comth of Ky
To } Copy Indictment & Judgment
P. H. CampbellRemit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
Govr
25th June/64
$86.
